page.shortlink: api client api a5 listbox setvalue method

argument.name: target
argument.description: The value(s) and or index(es) to use in the list. Pass in an array for values for multiple selections. See *[link:A5.ListBox.getIndex]*. Note: when using custom matching, only the first of the resulting indexes will be used.

property.name: select
property.description: The type of custom selection to do. Values are "all", "add", "remove", "toggle", "match", "group" and "view". The "all" custom selection will select all values in the list. The "add, "remove" and "toggle" custom selections will perform those actions with the passed in value(s). The"match" custom selection will use a passed in function to match values to select. The "group" custom selection will select the given group(s) by name (the title of the group). The "view custom selection selects all rows visible in the current view.

property.name: value
property.description: The value(s) to use in for "add", "remove" or "toggle". Pass in an array of values for multiple selections.

property.name: group
property.description: The group(s) to select for the "group" custom selection. Pass in an array of gorups to select multiple groups.

property.name: match
property.description: The function to use to match value(s) to be selected. This will be called for each value, and the function should return true or false to indicate if the value should be selected or not.

argument.name: value
argument.description: The value of a row in the list.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The data of a row in the list.

argument.name: executeSelect
argument.description: Whether or not to execute the select events. The change event will always be executed when the value changes.

page.description: Set the value in the list.
